[{'company': {'id': 30451, 'name': 'Hivos -Humanist Organisation for Social Change-', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFoDcl1sI3H7w/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856204380?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=5TqxQcUt7Tc9SQ7CCd6e-JBcufUPSzwToUd2fkc6Cuc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/hivos/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Hivos', 'description': 'Responsible for the management of the overall HIV and Human Rights program at the global office of Hivos, based in the Hague, the Netherlands, as well as the focal point of Hivos Global Office with the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria Headquarters in Geneva.
 
The global program supports sharing of knowledge and best practices between the Global Fund HIV civil society country grants in Bolivia, Guatemala and Costa Rica and the regional grants in South East Asia, ICW Latina and KP Reach in Southern Africa. All grants address the critical enablers of Key Populations in HIV. The program aims at influencing political space, documenting good practices and accelerating impact. The – thus far- six programs cover 26 countries all-together. In addition, the global program aims to influence political space, documenting good practices and accelerating impact. 

In addition, I am the team leader of the Hivos’ Technical Assistance Facility for the CRG (Community Rights and Gender) division of the Global Fund tasked with supporting countries and communities to improve the quality of their proposals. I supervise the “Making the Global Fund money work” a private public collaboration project in the Philippines and am furthermore responsible for the Tripartite Partnership for Key Populations in conjunction with Unaids and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs.', 'title': 'Senior Strategist HIV and Human Rights', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Hivos', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Hivos', 'description': 'Responsible for overall management of large scale HIV/AIDS project in Guatemala. The project comprised a team of 21 local staff members and was funded by the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria, based in Geneva. As part of its activities, the project I led, supported 31 local civil society organizations and health care clinics throughout the country. I was responsible for liaising and coordination with the national authorities on the implementation of the activities. And, for the launch of several publications and baseline studies on key populations, as well as for the organisation of the regional meeting of princial recipients of Latin America and the Carribbean, in conjunction with UNAIDS.', 'title': 'Director Principal Recipient Guatemala - Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'Hivos', 'description': 'Responsible for managing the portfolio of HIV/AIDS in different countries - including Bolivia, Peru, Ecuador and Kyrgyzstan - as part of the global HIV/AIDS team of Hivos.
